byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone contributed reporting from New York.

abstract: Indian disaster management officials announce deaths of over 70 people, almost all agricultural workers, by lightning strikes that accompanied first heavy rains of monsoon season.
lead_paragraph: Lightning strikes that punctuated the monsoon season’s inaugural heavy rains left scores of farmers and others dead in the country’s northeast.

headline.main: Lightning in India Kills More Than 70, Mostly Farmworkers
headline.print_headline: Lightning in India Kills Over 70, Many on Farms

snippet: Lightning strikes that punctuated the monsoon season’s inaugural heavy rains left scores of farmers and others dead in the country’s northeast.
